reviews.review_msg: good guy. can be tough, though.
He is by far one of the worst profs in the crim department
Liz is great by far the best prof in the faculty, if I was 20 years older I would definitely give her husband a run for the money
great lady, take any class you can with her
No Comments

Absolutely phenominal! Sheri will go to the hills and back to help you achieve what you want.  Her insight, experience and knowledge are much more than many, and she looks out for you 100%.  Made my last bit of time at SFU EXTREMELY enjoyable!
He's so hot!!!!

Richard is a nice prof and cares for his students but his lectures are so boring. His slides are directly from the textbook and reads off them. He tells many stories of his past careers and sometimes they can trail on for a very long time. Lectures are basically useless and better off if you do them on your own.

Professor Konarski spends at least 20 minutes on a single slide and is terrible at giving useful feedback. His instructions for the final term paper are so unclear, and he doesn't bother to clarify anything despite how many emails you send. Lecture slides aren't of much help, but I guess he's a somewhat chill professor.

In lecture he uses the online textbook provided slides and reads straight from the textbook. Not very engaging prof at all and you don't actually need to attend lecture as long as you keep up on your reading. meh.
Reads straight from the textbook so lectures are not mandatory. Midterm was very fair and easy. Not very much guidance on the final paper. If you read the textbook, the class will be easy.

The mid-term exam was not too bad but, the final exam was way different. Most students that got A's on the midterm got around 50% on the final. Does not give guidance on what to do for paper. Lectures are on news articles and is pushing his narrative and it does not relate to essay or exam questions. Very unclear in emails when asking questions.

Just a comment to everyone whining about the exams... they are only about memorization if you don't learn the material and understand it, just like any other class. Try reading your text and participating in the class discussions. Suck it up, you're not in high school anymore.
She was not helpful.

He is a good teacher who knows his stuff. He explains cases well and really clarifies the readings. Procedure and evidence is an awfull topic, but it isn't as bad with him. I don't think he is as funny as some people do though.
good but bland

Incredible professor. Great lecturer, with detailed slides and very intriguing stories. Clearly knowledgeable in her field and passionate. Testing and assignments were fair and not difficult to keep up with. Highly recommend.
Excellent classes, very interesting, great teaching, fair assignments. A+!!
really interesting stories, well structured classes, very organized, fair marker

This guy knows his stuff! He has that rare quality in university of not subscribing to the far left for it's own sake. He gives all arguments their due. And he tells facinating stories in class, as he has loads of real experience in criminal law. MARKS HARD! You can't trick this guy.

awesome prof! one of those hidden gems you wish you had every semester. very very helpful, funny, and entertaining! powerpoint lectures, copy the notes and memorize them. you won't need to read your text. leave at least a week to study prior to exam. stay for the review...most of the exam stuff is the review material
overall good prof... great lecturer
lordy lordy shes a bit of flake, suffers from delusions of grandeur
terrible instructor, infantalizing/condesending, look down upon people of color despite her apparent appearence of a woman of asian descent. talking tostudent with abrasive language
Not fair teacher. Can be so discriminatory to students with accecent. She herself uses fillers a lot, so annoying
No Comments
interesting, funny, fair marker / assignments, interesting classes!

this guy thinks hes all that cuz he gets interviewed in the province, always looks dishevelled like he just got off a plane from mexico, lots of talk but no even partly clear answer from boyd, makes you buy a bunch of books he wrote or is referenced to but you dont even use them so I felt really scammed spending all that money for nothingSTAY AWAY

Once you get that Bryan is sarcastic then the course is hilarious! He is very knowledgable in many areas aside from crim ie: Monty Python. Juts get to know him. Plus overcoming cancer has made him a stronger and funnier person.
very unclear at lectures, readings are very irrelevant to lecture and exams and midterms are very hard
leads to critical thinking, excellent
Simon, Simon, he's our man, if he can't do it no one can!!!
lots of info in course, but he's very passionate, animated, intelligent!
